availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Elizabeth Spencer Gambill. Father of Granville Gambill, Delila Gambill, Joseph Gambill, Isabel Gambill, William Gambill, John Gambill, and Louise Gambill. Farmer in Breathitt County in 1850. Resident of Perry County, Kentucky, in 1853. Farmer in Perry County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Perry County in 1860. Enlisted in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private on September 1, 1862. Reported as a deserted in Morgan County, Kentucky, on October 23, 1862. Killed on October 27, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 43B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Perry County, District 1, pp. 718-9.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Perry County, District 1, p. 192A.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994052, Perry County Births.
"John Gambill (1825-1862)," Find A Grave, Memorial 32521081, accessed August 10, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/32521081.
